learn
everyday english for speaking daily
english conversation
introduce people and greetings
you will learn to introduce other people
and greetings
in english good morning susan
good morning peter john
this is susan and susan this is my
friend
john hello
nice to meet you john hi
nice to meet you too susan
john do you live in this city
no i don't i am from new york
what do you do for work
i'm a journalist i work for the daily
newspaper
in new york what about you
i'm a lecturer what do you teach
i teach economics at the national
university
do you drive to work no
i go to work by bus it's very convenient
for me
oh shall we go for a drink
[Music]
nice to meet you a family is moving to a
new
apartment they meet their neighbor for
the first time
they have the greetings and
introductions to
each other
david help me this box is too heavy
just a moment mary
that's okay dad i can help mom
thanks tina i'm
so tired i am too merry
but there are a lot more boxes out there
to be moved
hi my name is joe williams and
this is my wife sue we live in the next
apartment
hello joe hello sue my name is mary
white
nice to meet you you must be the new
family living in this apartment
yes we are would you like to come in
joe and sue williams this is my husband
david and our daughter tina
hi joe nice to meet you hi sue
nice to meet you hello mr and mrs
williams
it's very nice to meet you
nice to meet you too nice to meet you
so can we help you
you have so many boxes
don't you mind we don't mind at all
we're happy to help our new neighbors
[Music]
can i have your name
you will learn to say your name in
english
you will also learn to give personal
information
in english can i help you
yes i'm a new student
welcome to the university can i have
your name
stephanie how do you spell stephanie
s t e f
a n i e
and what's your family name
my family name is young
okay stephanie here's your student card
thank you oh my name's not correct
oh sorry how do you spell it
it's young y o
u n g
y o u n
g that's right
that's fine stephanie you will stay in
room
101 room 101
yes
[Music]
where are you from
here you will learn to greet other
people
asking where they are from
hello hi
how are you i'm fine
thank you what about you
i'm good my name is jane
nice to meet you i'm ryan
nice to meet you too where are you from
i'm from the united states and you
i'm from england
have you got any brothers and sisters
listen to a conversation between craig
and lucy
pay attention to the use of the verb
have
got and has got in the conversation
have you got any brothers and sisters
lucy
no i haven't what about you
i've got a sister but i haven't got any
brothers
is your sister married
yes she is
has she got any children
no she hasn't well
not yet anyway have you got a photo
yes i have i've got some photos of my
family
in that drawer over there
oh she's got lovely long dark hair
no she hasn't got dark hair
she's got fair hair oh
that isn't my sister
that's uh rachel
an old girlfriend now
why have i got that in there
yes i wonder
[Music]
your english is very good
listen to a conversation between a man
and a woman pay attention to their names
their nationalities and the countries
that they talk about
brad churchill nice to meet you
sue takahashi nice to meet you too
your english is very good
thanks but i'm from canada
oh i'm sorry but
takahashi is a japanese name
yes my family is from japan
but i'm canadian
ah yes my name's
churchill very english but i'm
australian
from sydney oh i know
sydney really
hey let's go and have a coffee
okay yeah
talking about life
you will hear a reporter asking people
from different
countries about life
excuse me do you have a moment
yes you aren't american
no no i'm from japan
i'm on holiday here
okay so my question is
what's the difference for you about life
here
um well here people live in houses
they live in big houses
i'm from tokyo and we live in flats
small flats so
that's very different
and so for you what's different
about life here um
well i study at university here
and it's very different from my country
because here
in the united states the students have
jobs
they work in the evenings maybe 10 hours
a week
and you do you work
me no i don't i don't have time
and in my country students
don't work they only study
what's different here um
oh yeah people drive everywhere
i mean they drive 200 meters to the
shops
do you have a car yes
i do but i don't drive to the shops
not 200 meters i walk
and where are you from
i'm from england i think it's not so
different
i'm from italy and my american friends
are
not so different from me
er we like sports
we like clothes we
we go to the cinema restaurants
have a coffee so
you like the same things
yeah the same not different
have you ever been to the taj mahal
you will learn to use the present
perfect and past
simple tense have you ever been to the
taj mahal
yes i have i've been to the taj mahal
three or four times
in fact i was there three weeks ago
really did you go with lucy
no i didn't i went with some friends
from work
oh you're so lucky i've never
visited india india
oh i haven't been to india either
but i've eaten at the taj mahal
restaurant near the cinema
i ate there three weeks ago the food was
very good
did you have a good holiday
you will hear a conversation between two
people
talking about what happened on the
holiday
hello did you have a good holiday
yes we did thanks it was great
where did you we went
on a cruise in the caribbean
wonderful where did you get on the boat
in florida we flew to miami
was the flight okay well yes
but we had a bit of a problem because
we forgot the tickets
we left them on the kitchen table
oh no when did you realize that
we were at the airport what did you do
luckily our daughter lives near us so we
phoned her
and she went to the house and drove to
the airport
with the tickets that
wasn't a good start to a holiday
no it wasn't did you miss
the plane yes we did
but they put us on another plane so it
wasn't too bad
and we didn't miss the boat in florida
that's good
did you have a good weekend
jane and her friend are talking about
what they did
on the weekend listen to their
conversation
and learn how to use the past simple
hi jane how are you
hi monica i'm fine thank you
and you fine
did you have a good weekend
yes it was okay
what did you do well
on saturday morning i cleaned my flat
then in the afternoon i went into town
and i met my boyfriend
rob and we went shopping
did you buy anything
yes i bought a few things some clothes
and a book but then i lost my mobile
phone
oh no what did you do
well we went back to all the shops
did you find it huh yes
it was in the bookshop wow
that was very lucky
yes it was anyway
in the evening we went to the theater
we saw a very good play the birthday
it was very funny oh yes
we saw that last week it's very good
what did you do on sunday
i did the washing in the morning and
then i cleaned the car
in the afternoon i went to my
parents and i took their dog for a walk
in the park
in the evening i just watched tv
anyway what about you did you have a
good weekend
[Music]
how to describe locations in english
you will learn to describe the locations
of the buildings
in your city when describing locations
we often use some prepositions of place
what's your town like
well it's quite old there's a big square
in the town center it's called
town hall square because the town hall
is there
here i've got a postcard of the square
the town hall is the big building at the
end of the square
is there a market in the square
yes there is there's a market every
wednesday
and once a year there's a french market
too
a french market yes
people from france come to town and you
can buy french
cheese and bread and things like that
that sounds nice what are the other
buildings in the square
well on one side of the square there is
a big hotel
the angel hotel there's a good
restaurant at the hotel
and there's a club in the cellar too we
usually go there on saturday nights
opposite the hotel there's a museum
what kind of museum is it
oh there are photographs and things
about the town there
next to the museum between the museum
and the town hall
there's a cafe when the weather's nice
you can sit outside in front of it
what are the shops oh
well when you leave the town hall square
there's a post office on the corner next
to the hotel
then you come into penny street
most of the shops are there there are
clothes
shops shoe shops banks
the normal places
[Music]
are there any restaurants near here
listen to the conversation between a
stranger
and a woman at the information center
the stranger is asking for information
about where to eat
and stay in the city
can i help you yes
are there any restaurants in the station
yes there are but what's the time
half past eleven ah
they're closed now but there's a snack
bar over there
that's open and
is there a cash machine here
yes over there thanks
and hotels there are two hotels near
here
the charlotte street hotel that's about
250 pounds a night
250 pounds that's expensive
and there's the rich mount that's about
80 pounds where's that
it's here on the map okay
thank you for your help
ordering food and drink at the
restaurant
people are discussing what they will
order for dinner
at the restaurant
i'm hungry can we find something to eat
sure
this restaurant looks nice can we sit
over there by the window
yeah it's a very nice place for having
dinner
can you pass me the menu please
what are you going to drink
i want to have a glass of beer what
about you
i think i will have lemon juice
do you think we can order cheese salad
for an appetizer
i prefer artisan rolls but if you want
we can order cheese salad
what about the main course what do you
recommend
well the short ribs look very nice i'll
take this one
and the salmon here is very tasty i
think you should try it
that's good oh i'd like to have a
cupcake for dessert
what are you going to have that's enough
for me
i'm not that hungry okay
i'm gonna go find the toilet now when
the waiter comes
please order for me of course
no problem
[Music]
do you want something to drink
sue is inviting sarah to visit her new
house
pay attention to sue's offer of a drink
to sarah
hello it is lovely to see you again
please come in hi
thank you for inviting me to your home
do you want something to drink
yes thank you that would be nice
what would you like to drink i have pure
apple juice
grape juice and orange juice
well orange juice would be nice if it's
not too much
trouble don't worry
i go shopping every day and i buy a lot
of fruit
wait a moment i'll come back very soon
very nice
[Music]
here you are thank you very much
do you want to have some ice cubes in it
no thanks i don't like cold drinks
please let me know if you want some more
fruit juice
i will thank you by the way
where do you buy these oranges they
taste
very good oh
i usually go shopping at the local shop
and
at the end of this building
they sell a lot of fresh fruits from
their own farm
it's very healthy would you like to have
one more glass
no thanks it's enough for me that's very
kind of you
[Music]
happy birthday lucy
it's lucy's birthday today a lot of
people come to the party to celebrate
her birthday listen to the conversation
and learn how to use the past tense
that was a great surprise thank you very
much sarah
oh don't thank me i didn't do it
it was jordan jordan
but well we all
helped i invited everybody
peter got the drinks and cindy and ryan
made the food

oh hi lucy
happy birthday are you enjoying the

thank you sarah said that you organized

oh well everyone helped
i didn't do a lot really
yes but it was a nice idea
thank you
that's okay are you
doing anything oh
sorry after you no you first
okay are you doing anything
at the weekend
talking about likes and dislikes in
english listen to linda
and her children talking about what
their favorite subjects
at school are so
is this your class at school adam
yes it is that's
me with my friend martin
that's mrs harris she's our geography
teacher
she's really good i like geography
it's my favorite subject
what other subjects do you like
oh well i like it
what's i.t information technology
you know computers and things
oh i see well there weren't any
computers when
i was at school oh
right i like art too but i don't like
cookery
and they don't like english very much
and what about you holly what's your
favorite subject
well i like p.e but my favorite subject
is french
oh are you good at languages
yes i am i was good at languages too
when i was at school french and german
but my favorite was latin
latin wow cool we don't do that at our
school
and which subjects don't you like
i don't like science well
biology is okay i like that
but i don't like physics and chemistry
so what do you like joe
i like history and i like music too
oh and pe well you're good at sports
yeah but history is my favorite subject
i don't like
math i'm not very good at it
[Music]
starting an informal conversation
nick and becky have come to a college to
enroll
in an evening course in spanish
while they are waiting to enroll they
start up a conversation
the course looks popular doesn't it
yes it does have you done spanish before
no i haven't but i've just got a job in
international sales so i thought it
would be good to learn
spanish what about you
i've done a course before but the
trouble is
if you don't practice you forget
everything
i don't really need it for my job
so i'm worried the same thing might
happen again
what exactly do you do i'm
an accountant well
you could always work in spain they need
accountants too
that's an idea oh look
you're next in the queue good luck
how to respond and keep the conversation
going
learn to respond in conversation with
different expressions
ways to make questions and to keep the
english conversation
going miserable weather
isn't it i was in
mallorca last week and the weather was
fantastic
so hot and sunny not like here
mallorca yes
i was there last weekend
oh what were you doing there
my best friends just moved there and
i went to visit it was a good
opportunity to practice my spanish
how long have you been speaking spanish
i haven't spoken it since
uh i did it at school
so you were saying you were in melorka
what's it like it's amazing
i'd really recommend it
it's quite touristy though isn't it
well yes on the coast but in the
countryside
in the mountains it's really quite
perfect
for just walking reading just relaxing
i love reading on holidays there never
seems to be enough time to read at home
don't you think yes
i know what you mean i've been reading
the same book for about two months
how to exchange information in english
learn to speak english and learn ways to
exchange
information in english how to share
information
without having cultural problems
hi i'm theo you're doing that fashion
shoot with rick
aren't you yes i'm katie
i hear you used to work with rick on
some of our earlier campaigns
yes that's right we've done several
shoots together
he's a very talented guy i think his
coverage of fashion week for us was
fantastic
yes he's pretty amazing
but between you and me
i don't think he could have done it
without his team
that's so true katie it seems that he's
really good at picking the right people
to work with
by the way i heard a rumor that he's
going to be moving
to the new york office apparently he's
already found an
apartment in manhattan i overheard him
talking to an estate agent there a few
hours ago
i wonder how his wife feels about moving
to a new city
she's a journalist and she's just
started working for the times
well according to lorna
who knows someone at the times rick's
wife is fine about the move
she's going to give up being a
journalist and start writing a novel
i suppose they might move in the summer
when things are a bit quieter here
well i'm sure that we'll get to hear
about it soon
